name: Custom Events
summary: Standard for semantic analytics events (Segment Spec / Activity Streams).
description:
Design Philosophy

Tracking events should be semantic (User Behaviors) rather than tight-coupled to a vendor (Google Analytics). This standard adopts the Segment Spec vocabulary, focusing on the Who (Identity), What (Event), and Where (Context).

Interface Protocol

interface CustomAnalyticsEvent {    name: string; // e.g. 'Order Completed'    properties?: Record<string, unknown>; // e.g. { orderId: '50314b8e9bcf000000000000' }    options?: CustomAnalyticsOptions;}interface CustomAnalyticsIdentity {    userId: string;    traits?: Record<string, unknown>; // e.g. { email: 'bill@microsoft.com' }}interface CustomAnalyticsOptions {    integrations?: Record<string, boolean>; // e.g. { 'All': false, 'Mixpanel': true }    timestamp?: Date;}

name: Custom Tracker
summary: Protocol for analytics providers (Identify, Track, Page).
description:
Design Philosophy

The application should not know about Mixpanel or GA4. It should only know how to track(). Implementations can be swapped via Dependency Injection using @web-analytics.

Interface Protocol

interface CustomTracker {    // Who is the user?    identify(userId: string, traits?: Record<string, unknown>, options?: CustomAnalyticsOptions): void;    // What are they doing?    track(event: string, properties?: Record<string, unknown>, options?: CustomAnalyticsOptions): void;    // Where are they?    page(name?: string, category?: string, properties?: Record<string, unknown>, options?: CustomAnalyticsOptions): void;    // Grouping accounts (B2B)    group(groupId: string, traits?: Record<string, unknown>, options?: CustomAnalyticsOptions): void;}
